## Bio

Amia Graye is a current Master of Science Candidate in Biostatistics at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, expected to graduate in May of 2026.

Prior to the program, Amia Graye was a postbaccalaurete research fellow at the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI) at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). She worked in the Office of Biostatistics Research (OBR) under the advisement of Dong-Yun Kim, PhD. During her time at NHLBI, she worked with Marcus Carlsson, MD, PhD, and Eric Morgan, MD, PhD, in their Cardiac Magnetic Resonance (CMR) lab as a statistical analyst. She still currently works there as a special volunteer, but has lowered her role to prioritize her studies. 

## Interests
* Health disparities
* Minority health
* Women's health
* Sequential analysis
* Bayesian statistics
